ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: AUTHDOMAIN=authentication-domain] 
      
Specifies the name of an authentication domain metadata object in order to connect to the Hadoop 
server. The authentication domain references credentials (user ID and password) without your having 
to explicitly specify the credentials. The authentication-domain name is case sensitive, and it must 
be enclosed in double quotation marks.

[Syntax: OPTIONS=fileref | 'external-file'] 
      
Identifies the Hadoop configuration file to use for the associated PROC statement. The file must 
be an XML document. 

fileref 
  specifies the SAS fileref that is assigned to the Hadoop configuration file. To assign a fileref, 
  use the FILENAME statement.
  
'external-file'
  is the physical location of the XML document. Include the complete pathname and the filename. 
  Enclose the physical name in single or double quotation marks. The maximum length is 200 characters.

[Syntax: PASSWORD='password'] 
      
Is the password for the user ID on the Hadoop server. The user ID and password are added to the 
set of options that are identified by OPTIONS=.

Requirement: To specify PASSWORD=, you must also specify USERNAME=.

[Syntax: USERNAME='ID'] 
      
Is an authorized user ID on the Hadoop server. The user ID and password are added to the set of 
options that are identified by OPTIONS=.

Enables additional messages that are displayed on the SAS log. VERBOSE is a good error diagnostic 
tool. If you receive an error message when you invoke SAS, you can use this option to see whether 
you have an error in your system option specifications.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: COPYFROMLOCAL='local-file'] 
          
Copies the specified local file to an HDFS path output location. Specify the complete pathname 
and filename.

[Syntax: COPYTOLOCAL='HDFS-file'] 
          
Copies the specified HDFS file to a local file output location. Specify the complete HDFS directory 
and filename. 

Requirement: Use the OUT= option to specify the local file output location.

[Syntax: DELETE='HDFS-file'] 
          
Deletes the specified HDFS file. Specify the complete HDFS directory and filename. 

Interaction: If you attempt to delete a file that does not exist, a Warning message is issued. 
To suppress the Warning message, use the NOWARN option.

Deletes the input source file after a copy command. 
          
Restriction: Use DELETESOURCE with the COPYFROMLOCAL= or COPYTOLOCAL= options.

Saves the Cyclic Redundancy Check (CRC) file after a copy command to a local file output location. 
The CRC file is saved to the same location that is specified in the OUT= option. The CRC file is 
used to ensure the correctness of the file being copied. 

Default: The CRC file is deleted.

Restriction: Use KEEPCRC with the COPYTOLOCAL= option.

[Syntax: MKDIR='HDFS-path'] 
          
Creates the specified HDFS path. Specify the complete HDFS directory.

Suppresses the Warning message when there is an attempt to delete a file that does not exist. 
          
Restriction: Use NOWARN with the DELETE= option.

[Syntax: OUT='output-location'] 
          
Specifies the output location for an HDFS operation. When copying a local file to HDFS, specify 
the HDFS path. When copying an HDFS file to a local file, specify the external file for your 
machine. When renaming an HDFS file, specify the new HDFS path and filename.

Overwrites the output file after a copy command. 
          
Restriction: Use OVERWRITE with the COPYFROMLOCAL= or COPYTOLOCAL= options.

[Syntax: RENAME='HDFS-file'] 
          
Renames the specified HDFS file. Specify the complete HDFS directory and filename. 

Requirement: Use the OUT= option to specify the new HDFS path and filename.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: MAPREDUCE <hadoop-server-option(s)> <mapreduce-option(s)>; 
      
Submits MapReduce programs into a Hadoop cluster.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: COMBINE='class-name'] 
          
Specifies the name of the combiner class in dot notation.
Deletes the MapReduce results.

[Syntax: GROUPCOMPARE='class-name'] 
          
Specifies the name of the grouping comparator (GroupComparator) class in dot notation.

[Syntax: INPUT='HDFS-path'] 
          
Specifies the HDFS path to the MapReduce input file.

[Syntax: INPUTFORMAT='class-name'] 
          
Specifies the name of the input format class in dot notation.

[Syntax: JAR='external-file(s)'] 
          
Specifies the locations of the JAR files that contain the MapReduce program and named classes. 
Include the complete pathname and the filename. Enclose each location in single or double 
quotation marks.

[Syntax: MAP='class-name'] 
          
Specifies the name of the map class in dot notation. A map class contains elements that are formed 
by the combination of a key value and a mapped value.

[Syntax: OUTPUT='HDFS-path'] 
          
Specifies a new HDFS path for the MapReduce output.

[Syntax: OUTPUTFORMAT='class-name'] 
          
Specifies the name of the output format class in dot notation.

[Syntax: OUTPUTKEY='class-name'] 
          
Specifies the name of the output key class in dot notation.

[Syntax: OUTPUTVALUE='class-name'] 
          
Is the name of the output value class in dot notation.

[Syntax: PARTITIONER='class-name'] 
          
Specifies the name of the partitioner class in dot notation. A partitioner class controls 
the partitioning of the keys of the intermediate map-outputs.

[Syntax: REDUCE='class-name'] 
          
Specifies the name of the reducer class in dot notation. The reduce class reduces a set of 
intermediate values that share a key to a smaller set of values.

[Syntax: REDUCETASKS='integer'] 
          
Specifies the number of reduce tasks.

[Syntax: SORTCOMPARE='class-name'] 
          
Specifies the name of the sort comparator class in dot notation.

[Syntax: WORKINGDIR='HDFS-path'] 
          
Specifies the name of the HDFS working directory path.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PIG <hadoop-server-option(s)> <pig-code-option(s)>; 
      
Submits Pig language code into a Hadoop cluster.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CODE=fileref | 'external-file'] 
          
Specifies the source that contains the Pig language code to execute. 

fileref
  is a SAS fileref that is assigned to the source file. To assign a fileref, use the 
  FILENAME statement.  
  
'external-file'
  is the physical location of the source file. Include the complete pathname and the filename. 
  Enclose the physical name in single or double quotation marks.

[Syntax: PARAMETERS=fileref | 'external-file'] 
          
specifies the source that contains parameters to be passed as arguments when the Pig code executes. 

fileref
  is a SAS fileref that is assigned to the source file. To assign a fileref, use the 
  FILENAME statement. 
  
'external-file'
  is the physical location of the source file. Include the complete pathname and the filename. 
  Enclose the physical name in single or double quotation marks.

[Syntax: REGISTERJAR='external-file(s)'] 
          
Specifies the locations of the JAR files that contain the Pig scripts to execute. Include the 
complete pathname and the filename. Enclose each location in single or double quotation marks.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROPERTIES | PROP <configuration-properties>; 
      
Submits configuration properties to the Hadoop server. 

Any property that can be specified in a Hadoop configuration file can be submitted to the 
Hadoop server by using the PROPERTIES statement. Enclose each property in single or double 
quotation marks, and enclose each value in single or double quotation marks. 

Example:

  prop 'mapred.job.tracker'='xxx.us.company.com:8021'
    'fs.default.name'='hdfs://xxx.us.company.com:8020';
